Class Sentence

java.lang.Object
unipd.edids.logicBusiness.entities.Sentence
public class Sentence extends Object
The Sentence class is responsible for representing and analyzing a sentence's structure, content, and attributes.

Responsibilities: - Encapsulates a sentence as text and its associated syntactic structure. - Maintains attributes such as syntactic tree, nouns, verbs, adjectives, and various content metrics (e.g., toxicity, profanity). - Provides methods for managing and analyzing syntactic and linguistic features of the sentence. - Offers configuration for content metrics with value constraints.

Design Patterns: - Builder-like approach: Utilizes StringBuilders for constructing sentence and structure data.

    • setToxicity

      public void setToxicity(double value)

      Parameters:
      value - A double representing the toxicity level, constrained between 0 and 1.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the provided value is outside the range [0, 1].

    • setProfanity

      public void setProfanity(double value)

      Parameters:
      value - The profanity score to set. Must be a double between 0 and 1.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the value is outside the valid range.

    • setInsult

      Throws:
